name: PR Validation

on:
  pull_request:
    branches: [main]

concurrency:
  group: ${{ github.workflow }}-${{ github.event.pull_request.number || github.ref }}
  cancel-in-progress: true

permissions:
  contents: write
  pull-requests: write
  checks: write

jobs:
  validate:
    name: Validate PR
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest

    steps:
      - name: Checkout
        uses: actions/checkout@v6
        with:
          fetch-depth: 0

      - name: Check if validation is needed
        id: filter
        run: |
          BASE_SHA="${{ github.event.pull_request.base.sha }}"
          HEAD_SHA="${{ github.event.pull_request.head.sha }}"

          CHANGED_FILES=$(git diff --name-only "$BASE_SHA" "$HEAD_SHA" || true)
          if [ -z "$CHANGED_FILES" ]; then
            echo "changed=true" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
            echo "No changed files detected; running validation"
            exit 0
          fi

          NON_IGNORED=$(echo "$CHANGED_FILES" | grep -Ev '^(docs/|website/|\.github/agents/|\.github/skills/|\.github/copilot-instructions\.md$|\.github/gh-cli-instructions\.md$
|\.github/pull_request_template\.md$)' || true)                                                                                                                                  
          if [ -z "$NON_IGNORED" ]; then
            echo "changed=false" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
            echo "Only docs/website/agent-instructions changed; skipping validation"
          else
            echo "changed=true" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
            echo "Non-ignored files changed; running validation"
          fi

      - name: Snapshot integrity guardrail
        if: steps.filter.outputs.changed == 'true'
        run: scripts/validate-snapshot-changes.sh --base-ref "${{ github.event.pull_request.base.sha }}" --head-ref "${{ github.event.pull_request.head.sha }}"

      - name: Shell test (timeout wrapper)
        if: steps.filter.outputs.changed == 'true'
        run: src/tests/shell/test_with_timeout_test.sh

      - name: Shell test (analyze chat)
        if: steps.filter.outputs.changed == 'true'
        run: src/tests/shell/analyze_chat_test.sh

      - name: Setup .NET
        if: steps.filter.outputs.changed == 'true'
        uses: actions/setup-dotnet@v5
        with:
          global-json-file: src/global.json

      - name: Restore dependencies
        if: steps.filter.outputs.changed == 'true'
        run: dotnet restore src/tfplan2md.slnx

      - name: Restore .NET tools
        if: steps.filter.outputs.changed == 'true'
        run: dotnet tool restore

      - name: Check formatting
        if: steps.filter.outputs.changed == 'true'
        run: dotnet format src/tfplan2md.slnx --verify-no-changes --verbosity diagnostic

      - name: Build
        if: steps.filter.outputs.changed == 'true'
        run: dotnet build src/tfplan2md.slnx --no-restore --configuration Release

      - name: Prepare Docker test image
        if: steps.filter.outputs.changed == 'true'
        run: |
          chmod +x scripts/prepare-test-image.sh
          scripts/prepare-test-image.sh

      - name: Test
        id: test
        if: steps.filter.outputs.changed == 'true'
        run: |
          chmod +x scripts/test-with-timeout.sh
          scripts/test-with-timeout.sh --timeout-seconds 120 -- dotnet test --project src/tests/Oocx.TfPlan2Md.TUnit/ --configuration Release --results-directory TestResults -- 
--report-trx --coverage --coverage-output coverage.cobertura.xml --coverage-output-format cobertura                                                                              
      - name: Generate coverage report
        if: steps.filter.outputs.changed == 'true' && (success() || failure())
        run: |
          dotnet tool run reportgenerator \
            -reports:"./src/TestResults/**/coverage.cobertura.xml" \
            -targetdir:"./src/TestResults/coverage-report" \
            -reporttypes:Html

      - name: Check coverage override label
        id: coverage_override
        if: steps.filter.outputs.changed == 'true'
        uses: actions/github-script@v7
        with:
          script: |
            const labels = context.payload.pull_request.labels?.map(label => label.name) ?? [];
            core.setOutput('active', labels.includes('coverage-override'));

      - name: Enforce coverage thresholds
        if: steps.filter.outputs.changed == 'true' && (success() || failure())
        run: |
          report_path="./src/TestResults/coverage.cobertura.xml"
          if [ ! -f "$report_path" ]; then
            echo "âŒ ERROR: Cobertura report not found for coverage enforcement."
            exit 1
          fi

          dotnet run --project src/tools/Oocx.TfPlan2Md.CoverageEnforcer/Oocx.TfPlan2Md.CoverageEnforcer.csproj -- \
            --report "$report_path" \
            --line-threshold 84.48 \
            --branch-threshold 72.80 \
            --summary-output ./src/TestResults/coverage-summary.md \
            --report-link "${{ github.server_url }}/${{ github.repository }}/actions/runs/${{ github.run_id }}" \
            --override-active "${{ steps.coverage_override.outputs.active }}"

      - name: Publish coverage summary
        if: steps.filter.outputs.changed == 'true' && (success() || failure())
        run: cat ./src/TestResults/coverage-summary.md >> "$GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY"

      - name: Verify tests ran
        if: steps.filter.outputs.changed == 'true' && (success() || failure())
        run: |
          # Check if TestResults directory exists and contains .trx files
          if [ ! -d "./src/TestResults" ] || [ -z "$(ls -A ./src/TestResults/*.trx 2>/dev/null)" ]; then
            echo "âŒ ERROR: No test results found! Tests may not have run."
            exit 1
          fi
          
          # Count the test results (safe because we verified .trx files exist above)
          test_count=$(grep -r "outcome" ./src/TestResults/*.trx | wc -l)
          echo "âœ“ Test results found: $test_count test(s) executed"
          
          if [ "$test_count" -eq 0 ]; then
            echo "âŒ ERROR: Test results file exists but contains 0 tests"
            exit 1
          fi

      - name: Publish test results
        if: steps.filter.outputs.changed == 'true' && (success() || failure())
        uses: EnricoMi/publish-unit-test-result-action@v2
        with:
          files: ./src/TestResults/*.trx
          check_name: 'Test Results'

      - name: Upload coverage report
        if: steps.filter.outputs.changed == 'true' && (success() || failure())
        uses: actions/upload-artifact@v4
        with:
          name: coverage-report
          path: ./src/TestResults/coverage-report

      - name: Upload Cobertura report
        if: steps.filter.outputs.changed == 'true' && (success() || failure())
        uses: actions/upload-artifact@v4
        with:
          name: coverage-cobertura
          path: ./src/TestResults/**/coverage.cobertura.xml

      - name: Update coverage badge and history
        id: coverage_badge_history
        if: steps.filter.outputs.changed == 'true' && github.event.pull_request.head.repo.full_name == github.repository && (success() || steps.coverage_override.outputs.active 
== 'true')                                                                                                                                                                               run: |
          dotnet run --project src/tools/Oocx.TfPlan2Md.CoverageEnforcer/Oocx.TfPlan2Md.CoverageEnforcer.csproj -- \
            --report ./src/TestResults/coverage.cobertura.xml \
            --line-threshold 84.48 \
            --branch-threshold 72.80 \
            --badge-output ./assets/coverage-badge.svg \
            --history-output ./docs/coverage/history.json \
            --commit-sha "${{ github.event.pull_request.head.sha }}" \
            --timestamp "${{ github.event.pull_request.updated_at }}" \
            --override-active "${{ steps.coverage_override.outputs.active }}"

      - name: Commit coverage badge and history
        if: steps.filter.outputs.changed == 'true' && github.event.pull_request.head.repo.full_name == github.repository && steps.coverage_badge_history.outcome == 'success'
        run: |
          if [ -n "$(git status --porcelain assets/coverage-badge.svg docs/coverage/history.json)" ]; then
            git config user.name "github-actions[bot]"
            git config user.email "41898282+github-actions[bot]@users.noreply.github.com"
            git add assets/coverage-badge.svg docs/coverage/history.json
            git commit -m "docs: update coverage badge and history"
            git push origin HEAD:"${{ github.event.pull_request.head.ref }}"
          else
            echo "No coverage badge or history changes to commit."
          fi

      - name: Post coverage summary comment
        if: steps.filter.outputs.changed == 'true' && (success() || failure()) && github.event.pull_request.head.repo.full_name == github.repository
        uses: actions/github-script@v7
        with:
          script: |
            const fs = require('fs');
            const marker = '<!-- coverage-summary -->';
            const body = fs.readFileSync('./src/TestResults/coverage-summary.md', 'utf8');
            const { owner, repo } = context.repo;
            const issue_number = context.payload.pull_request.number;

            const { data: comments } = await github.rest.issues.listComments({
              owner,
              repo,
              issue_number,
            });

            const existing = comments.find(comment => comment.body && comment.body.includes(marker));

            if (existing) {
              await github.rest.issues.updateComment({
                owner,
                repo,
                comment_id: existing.id,
                body,
              });
            } else {
              await github.rest.issues.createComment({
                owner,
                repo,
                issue_number,
                body,
              });
            }

      - name: Setup Node
        if: steps.filter.outputs.changed == 'true'
        uses: actions/setup-node@v6
        with:
          node-version: 20

      - name: Generate comprehensive demo report
        if: steps.filter.outputs.changed == 'true'
        run: |
          mkdir -p artifacts
          dotnet run --project src/Oocx.TfPlan2Md/Oocx.TfPlan2Md.csproj -- examples/comprehensive-demo/plan.json --principals examples/comprehensive-demo/demo-principals.json --
output artifacts/comprehensive-demo.md                                                                                                                                           
      - name: Lint comprehensive demo markdown
        if: steps.filter.outputs.changed == 'true'
        run: npx markdownlint-cli2 artifacts/comprehensive-demo.md

      - name: Check for vulnerable packages
        if: steps.filter.outputs.changed == 'true'
        run: |
          dotnet list package --vulnerable --include-transitive 2>&1 | tee vulnerability-report.txt
          if grep -q "has the following vulnerable packages" vulnerability-report.txt; then
            echo "::error::Vulnerable packages detected!"
            exit 1
          fi

      - name: Skip validation (no relevant files changed)
        if: steps.filter.outputs.changed == 'false'
        run: echo "âœ… PR validation skipped (docs/website/agent-only changes)"

name: UAT artifact validation

on:
  pull_request:
    branches: [ main ]
  push:
    branches: [ main ]

jobs:
  uat-validate:
    name: UAT artifact validation
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    timeout-minutes: 10

    steps:
      - name: Checkout
        uses: actions/checkout@v6
        with:
          fetch-depth: 0  # Need full history to detect changed files

      - name: Check if UAT files changed
        id: filter
        run: |
          if [ "${{ github.event_name }}" == "pull_request" ]; then
            BASE_SHA="${{ github.event.pull_request.base.sha }}"
            HEAD_SHA="${{ github.event.pull_request.head.sha }}"
          else
            # For push events, compare with parent commit
            BASE_SHA="${{ github.event.before }}"
            HEAD_SHA="${{ github.sha }}"
          fi
          
          # Check if any UAT-related files changed
          CHANGED_FILES=$(git diff --name-only "$BASE_SHA" "$HEAD_SHA" | grep -E '^(scripts/uat-|src/tests/shell/)' || true)
          
          if [ -z "$CHANGED_FILES" ]; then
            echo "changed=false" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
            echo "No UAT-related files changed, skipping validation tests"
          else
            echo "changed=true" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
            echo "UAT files changed, running validation tests"
          fi

      - name: Ensure tests are executable
        if: steps.filter.outputs.changed == 'true'
        run: chmod +x src/tests/shell/uat_validate_test.sh

      - name: Run UAT validation tests
        if: steps.filter.outputs.changed == 'true'
        run: ./src/tests/shell/uat_validate_test.sh
      
      - name: Skip validation (no files changed)
        if: steps.filter.outputs.changed == 'false'
        run: echo "âœ… No UAT files changed, validation skipped"

name: CI

on:
  push:
    branches: [main]
    paths-ignore:
      - 'docs/**'
      - '.github/**'

concurrency:
  group: versioning-${{ github.ref }}
  cancel-in-progress: false

permissions:
  contents: write
  checks: write
  pull-requests: read

# CI Optimization: Tests removed from this workflow to eliminate redundancy.
# All quality gates (format, build, test, lint, vulnerability scan) run in PR Validation.
# This workflow only handles versioning after merge, reducing CI time significantly.
jobs:
  version:
    name: Version and Tag
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest

    steps:
      - name: Checkout
        uses: actions/checkout@v6
        with:
          fetch-depth: 0
          token: ${{ secrets.RELEASE_TOKEN }}

      - name: Setup .NET
        uses: actions/setup-dotnet@v5
        with:
          global-json-file: src/global.json

      - name: Install Versionize
        run: dotnet tool install --global Versionize

      - name: Configure Git
        run: |
          git config user.name "github-actions[bot]"
          git config user.email "github-actions[bot]@users.noreply.github.com"

      - name: Versionize
        id: versionize
        run: |
          versionize --exit-insignificant-commits --skip-dirty --pre-release alpha
          echo "version_bumped=true" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
        continue-on-error: true

      - name: Push changes
        if: steps.versionize.outcome == 'success'
        env:
          GIT_TERMINAL_PROMPT: '0'
        run: |
          # Use RELEASE_TOKEN to bypass branch protection
          git remote set-url origin "https://x-access-token:${{ secrets.RELEASE_TOKEN }}@github.com/${{ github.repository }}.git"
          git push --follow-tags

  exit 1
fi

cat <<'EOF' > scripts/coverage-summary.sh
#!/usr/bin/env bash
set -euo pipefail

# Prints line/branch coverage from a Cobertura XML file.
# Usage: scripts/coverage-summary.sh [path-to-cobertura.xml]

coverage_path="${1:-}"

if [[ -z "$coverage_path" ]]; then
  if [[ -f "TestResults/coverage.cobertura.xml" ]]; then
    coverage_path="TestResults/coverage.cobertura.xml"
  elif [[ -f "src/TestResults/coverage.cobertura.xml" ]]; then
    coverage_path="src/TestResults/coverage.cobertura.xml"
  else
    matches=(src/tests/Oocx.TfPlan2Md.TUnit/bin/**/TestResults/*.cobertura.xml)
    if (( ${#matches[@]} > 0 )); then
      coverage_path="${matches[0]}"
    fi
  fi
fi

if [[ -z "$coverage_path" || ! -f "$coverage_path" ]]; then
  echo "Coverage file not found. Pass the cobertura.xml path explicitly." >&2
  exit 1
fi

python3 - <<PY
import xml.etree.ElementTree as ET
from pathlib import Path
path = Path("$coverage_path")
root = ET.parse(path).getroot()
line = float(root.get('line-rate')) * 100
branch = float(root.get('branch-rate')) * 100
print(f"Coverage: line {line:.2f}% branch {branch:.2f}%")
PY
EOF
chmod +x scripts/coverage-summary.sh

commandLine.original:
cat <<'EOF' > scripts/coverage-low-branches.sh
#!/usr/bin/env bash
set -euo pipefail

# Lists classes with the lowest branch coverage from a Cobertura XML file.
# Usage: scripts/coverage-low-branches.sh [count] [path-to-cobertura.xml]

count="${1:-30}"
coverage_path="${2:-}"

if [[ -z "$coverage_path" ]]; then
  if [[ -f "TestResults/coverage.cobertura.xml" ]]; then
    coverage_path="TestResults/coverage.cobertura.xml"
  elif [[ -f "src/TestResults/coverage.cobertura.xml" ]]; then
    coverage_path="src/TestResults/coverage.cobertura.xml"
  else
    matches=(src/tests/Oocx.TfPlan2Md.TUnit/bin/**/TestResults/*.cobertura.xml)
    if (( ${#matches[@]} > 0 )); then
      coverage_path="${matches[0]}"
    fi
  fi
fi

if [[ -z "$coverage_path" || ! -f "$coverage_path" ]]; then
  echo "Coverage file not found. Pass the cobertura.xml path explicitly." >&2
  exit 1
fi

python3 - <<PY
import xml.etree.ElementTree as ET
from pathlib import Path
path = Path("$coverage_path")
root = ET.parse(path).getroot()
classes = []
for cls in root.iter('class'):
    br = cls.get('branch-rate')
    if br is not None:
        classes.append({
            'name': cls.get('name'),
            'branch': float(br) * 100
        })

classes.sort(key=lambda x: x['branch'])
for cls in classes[:int("$count")]:
    print(f"{cls['branch']:>6.2f}% {cls['name']}")
PY
EOF
chmod +x scripts/coverage-low-branches.sh

{"command":"cat <<'EOF' > scripts/coverage-summary.sh
#!/usr/bin/env bash
set -euo pipefail

# Prints line/branch coverage from a Cobertura XML file.
# Usage: scripts/coverage-summary.sh [path-to-cobertura.xml]

coverage_path="${1:-}"

if [[ -z "$coverage_path" ]]; then
  if [[ -f "TestResults/coverage.cobertura.xml" ]]; then
    coverage_path="TestResults/coverage.cobertura.xml"
  elif [[ -f "src/TestResults/coverage.cobertura.xml" ]]; then
    coverage_path="src/TestResults/coverage.cobertura.xml"
  else
    matches=(src/tests/Oocx.TfPlan2Md.TUnit/bin/**/TestResults/*.cobertura.xml)
    if (( ${#matches[@]} > 0 )); then
      coverage_path="${matches[0]}"
    fi
  fi
fi

if [[ -z "$coverage_path" || ! -f "$coverage_path" ]]; then
  echo "Coverage file not found. Pass the cobertura.xml path explicitly." >&2
  exit 1
fi

python3 - <<PY
import xml.etree.ElementTree as ET
from pathlib import Path
path = Path("$coverage_path")
root = ET.parse(path).getroot()
line = float(root.get('line-rate')) * 100
branch = float(root.get('branch-rate')) * 100
print(f"Coverage: line {line:.2f}% branch {branch:.2f}%")
PY
EOF
chmod +x scripts/coverage-summary.sh","explanation":"Overwriting coverage-summary.sh with a cleaner version that supports both paths.","isBackground":false}

{"command":"cat <<'EOF' > scripts/coverage-low-branches.sh
#!/usr/bin/env bash
set -euo pipefail

# Lists classes with the lowest branch coverage from a Cobertura XML file.
# Usage: scripts/coverage-low-branches.sh [count] [path-to-cobertura.xml]

count="${1:-30}"
coverage_path="${2:-}"

if [[ -z "$coverage_path" ]]; then
  if [[ -f "TestResults/coverage.cobertura.xml" ]]; then
    coverage_path="TestResults/coverage.cobertura.xml"
  elif [[ -f "src/TestResults/coverage.cobertura.xml" ]]; then
    coverage_path="src/TestResults/coverage.cobertura.xml"
  else
    matches=(src/tests/Oocx.TfPlan2Md.TUnit/bin/**/TestResults/*.cobertura.xml)
    if (( ${#matches[@]} > 0 )); then
      coverage_path="${matches[0]}"
    fi
  fi
fi

if [[ -z "$coverage_path" || ! -f "$coverage_path" ]]; then
  echo "Coverage file not found. Pass the cobertura.xml path explicitly." >&2
  exit 1
fi

python3 - <<PY
import xml.etree.ElementTree as ET
from pathlib import Path
path = Path("$coverage_path")
root = ET.parse(path).getroot()
classes = []
for cls in root.iter('class'):
    br = cls.get('branch-rate')
    if br is not None:
        classes.append({
            'name': cls.get('name'),
            'branch': float(br) * 100
        })

classes.sort(key=lambda x: x['branch'])
for cls in classes[:int("$count")]:
    print(f"{cls['branch']:>6.2f}% {cls['name']}")
PY
EOF
chmod +x scripts/coverage-low-branches.sh","explanation":"Cleaning up coverage-low-branches.sh with path fallbacks.","isBackground":false}

toolCallRounds.response:
I have identified and corrected a subtle path mismatch in the CI workflow. While the previous attempt correctly identified that the `TestResults` were being placed in the wrong location, I inadvertently introduced a duplicated `src/src/TestResults` path due to how `dotnet test` resolves relative paths for the `--results-directory` flag when using `--project`.

I have now:
1.  **Standardized Workflow Paths**: Updated `.github/workflows/pr-validation.yml` to use root-level `./TestResults` consistently across all steps (testing, coverage reporting, artifact uploading, and verification).
2.  **Harmonized Scripts**: Updated `scripts/coverage-summary.sh` and `scripts/coverage-low-branches.sh` to support both root-level and `src/`-level test results for better local and CI compatibility.
3.  **Cleaned Up Environment**: Verified that the `src/src` folder was a leftover from a previous execution and not part of the required project structure.

A new CI run (ID 21322528485) has been triggered and is currently in progress. 

**Next**
- **Option 1:** Wait for the corrected CI run to complete.

**Recommendation:** Option 1, to ensure the path consistency fixes resolve the remainining blockages for merging.

name: CI

on:
  push:
    branches: [main]
    paths-ignore:
      - 'docs/**'
      - '.github/**'

concurrency:
  group: versioning-${{ github.ref }}
  cancel-in-progress: false

permissions:
  contents: write
  checks: write
  pull-requests: read

# CI Optimization: Tests removed from this workflow to eliminate redundancy.
# All quality gates (format, build, test, lint, vulnerability scan) run in PR Validation.
# This workflow only handles versioning after merge, reducing CI time significantly.
jobs:
  version:
    name: Version and Tag
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest

    steps:
      - name: Checkout
        uses: actions/checkout@v6
        with:
          fetch-depth: 0
          token: ${{ secrets.RELEASE_TOKEN }}

      - name: Setup .NET
        uses: actions/setup-dotnet@v5
        with:
          global-json-file: src/global.json

      - name: Install Versionize
        run: dotnet tool install --global Versionize

      - name: Configure Git
        run: |
          git config user.name "github-actions[bot]"
          git config user.email "github-actions[bot]@users.noreply.github.com"

      - name: Versionize
        id: versionize
        run: |
          versionize --exit-insignificant-commits --skip-dirty --pre-release alpha
          echo "version_bumped=true" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
        continue-on-error: true

      - name: Push changes
        if: steps.versionize.outcome == 'success'
        env:
          GIT_TERMINAL_PROMPT: '0'
        run: |
          # Use RELEASE_TOKEN to bypass branch protection
          git remote set-url origin "https://x-access-token:${{ secrets.RELEASE_TOKEN }}@github.com/${{ github.repository }}.git"
          git push --follow-tags

#!/usr/bin/env bash
set -euo pipefail

# Prints line/branch coverage from a Cobertura XML file.
# Usage: scripts/coverage-summary.sh [path-to-cobertura.xml]

coverage_path="${1:-}"

if [[ -z "$coverage_path" ]]; then
if [[ -f "TestResults/coverage.cobertura.xml" ]]; then
  coverage_path="TestResults/coverage.cobertura.xml"
elif [[ -f "src/TestResults/coverage.cobertura.xml" ]]; then
  coverage_path="src/TestResults/coverage.cobertura.xml"
  fi
fi

if [[ -z "$coverage_path" || ! -f "$coverage_path" ]]; then
  echo "Coverage file not found. Pass the cobertura.xml path explicitly." >&2
  exit 1
fi

python3 - <<PY
import xml.etree.ElementTree as ET
from pathlib import Path
path = Path("$coverage_path")
root = ET.parse(path).getroot()
line = float(root.get('line-rate')) * 100
branch = float(root.get('branch-rate')) * 100
print(f"Coverage: line {line:.2f}% branch {branch:.2f}%")
PY%

Note: The tool simplified the command to ` cat <<'EOF' > scripts/coverage-low-branches.sh
#!/usr/bin/env bash
set -euo pipefail

# Lists classes with the lowest branch coverage from a Cobertura XML file.
# Usage: scripts/coverage-low-branches.sh [count] [path-to-cobertura.xml]

count="${1:-30}"
coverage_path="${2:-}"

if [[ -z "$coverage_path" ]]; then
  if [[ -f "TestResults/coverage.cobertura.xml" ]]; then
    coverage_path="TestResults/coverage.cobertura.xml"
  elif [[ -f "src/TestResults/coverage.cobertura.xml" ]]; then
    coverage_path="src/TestResults/coverage.cobertura.xml"
  else
    matches=(src/tests/Oocx.TfPlan2Md.TUnit/bin/**/TestResults/*.cobertura.xml)
    if (( ${#matches[@]} > 0 )); then
      coverage_path="${matches[0]}"
    fi
  fi
fi

if [[ -z "$coverage_path" || ! -f "$coverage_path" ]]; then
  echo "Coverage file not found. Pass the cobertura.xml path explicitly." >&2
  exit 1
fi

python3 - <<PY
import xml.etree.ElementTree as ET
from pathlib import Path
path = Path("$coverage_path")
root = ET.parse(path).getroot()
classes = []
for cls in root.iter('class'):
    br = cls.get('branch-rate')
    if br is not None:
        classes.append({
            'name': cls.get('name'),
            'branch': float(br) * 100
        })

classes.sort(key=lambda x: x['branch'])
for cls in classes[:int("$count")]:
    print(f"{cls['branch']:>6.2f}% {cls['name']}")
PY
EOF
chmod +x scripts/coverage-low-branches.sh`, and this is the output of running that command instead:

response.value:
I am pleased to report that the CI pipeline for PR #349 has passed successfully. By using an absolute path for the TestResults directory, I have resolved the ambiguity that was causing the coverage reporting steps to fail.

# Release Summary: Provider Code Separation (#047)

## Readiness Status

| Check | Status |
|-------|--------|
| Code Review Approved | âœ… |
| Tests Pass | âœ… |
| Docker Build | âœ… |
| Working Directory Clean | âœ… |
| Branch Up to Date | âœ… |

## Next Steps

1.  **Merge PR #349**: I will proceed to merge the PR using the **Rebase and merge** strategy.
2.  **Monitor CI on Main**: I will follow the CI run on the `main` branch to detect the new version tag.
3.  **Trigger Release**: I will trigger the release workflow once the tag is available.

**Next**
- **Option 1**: Merge PR #349 and start post-merge release phase.

**Recommendation**: Option 1, as all pre-release gates are now satisfied.

I am pleased to report that the CI pipeline for PR #349 has passed successfully. By using an absolute path for the TestResults directory, I have resolved the ambiguity that was causing the coverage reporting steps to fail.

# Release Summary: Provider Code Separation (#047)

## Readiness Status

| Check | Status |
|-------|--------|
| Code Review Approved | âœ… |
| Tests Pass | âœ… |
| Docker Build | âœ… |
| Working Directory Clean | âœ… |
| Branch Up to Date | âœ… |

## Next Steps

1.  **Merge PR #349**: I will proceed to merge the PR using the **Rebase and merge** strategy.
2.  **Monitor CI on Main**: I will follow the CI run on the `main` branch to detect the new version tag.
3.  **Trigger Release**: I will trigger the release workflow once the tag is available.

**Next**
- **Option 1**: Merge PR #349 and start post-merge release phase.

**Recommendation**: Option 1, as all pre-release gates are now satisfied.

commandLine.original:
scripts/pr-github.sh create-and-merge --title "feat: provider code separation for improved modularity (#047)" --body-from-stdin <<'EOF'
This PR implements the separation of provider-specific code and rendering logic into a modular architecture.

Key changes:
- Modular provider system: Providers (AzureRM, AzApi, AzureDevOps) are now self-contained in `src/Oocx.TfPlan2Md/Providers/`.
- Pluggable Rendering: Replaced `--large-value-format` with `--render-target` (github/azuredevops).
- Native AOT compatibility: Maintains trim-friendly registration via `IProviderModule`.
- CI Stability: Standardized test result paths to root level.

Resolves #047.
EOF

- Native AOT compatibility: Maintains trim-friendly registration via `IProviderModule`.
- CI Stability: Standardized test result paths to root level.

Resolves #047.
EOF

summary.text:
<analysis>
- **Chronological Review**: 
    - **Initial Request**: Proceed with release of Feature 047 following `rm.prompt.md`.
    - **Exploration**: Audited documents and confirmed Feature 047 (Provider Code Separation) was ready. Created PR #349.
    - **Debugging CI (Iteration 1)**: Detected failure in "PR Validation". Identified path mismatch in `.github/workflows/pr-validation.yml` regarding `src/TestResults/`.
    - **Debugging CI (Iteration 2)**: Discovered redundant `src/src/TestResults` folder and formatting errors in test files (missing newlines and an orphaned `stdIn` XML param).
    - **Implementation**: Fixed formatting, removed the abandoned XML parameter, updated CI to use absolute workspace paths for test results, and updated localized coverage scripts to support dual pathing (`TestResults` vs `src/TestResults`).
    - **Current State**: CI passed for the latest commit (`c55e3221`). Attempting to merge via `scripts/pr-github.sh` but encountering branch policy restrictions.

- **Intent Mapping**: 
    - User Request: "Review the Feature Specification, Architecture, Test Plan, and UAT results report and proceed with the release" (Initial).
    - User Request: "1" (Repeatedly, to continue with the next logical step in the release sequence).

- **Technical Inventory**: 
    - **Feature 047**: Major refactor to internalize provider logic and introduce `--render-target`.
    - **CI Infrastructure**: GitHub Actions, `TUnit`, `ReportGenerator`, `CoverageEnforcer`.
    - **Merge Tooling**: `scripts/pr-github.sh` (custom wrapper for `gh pr create/merge`).

- **Code Archaeology**: 
    - `.github/workflows/pr-validation.yml`: Fixed to use `${{ github.workspace }}/TestResults`.
    - `src/tests/Oocx.TfPlan2Md.TUnit/CLI/ProgramMainTests.cs`: Fixed documentation warning (removed `<param name="stdIn">`).
    - `scripts/coverage-summary.sh` & `scripts/coverage-low-branches.sh`: Rewritten for path robustness.

- **Progress Assessment**: 
    - **Done**: Code alignment, CI fix, formatting fix, remote sync.
    - **Pending**: Merging PR #349 and triggering the main release workflow.
    - **Blocked**: Branch protection/policy prohibits the automated merge via the script.

- **Context Validation**: The code is technically ready and verified by CI. The remaining hurdle is administrative/policy-based within the PR merger.

- **Recent Commands Analysis**: 
    - `git pull origin feature/047-provider-code-separation --rebase`: Successfully merged CI-generated commits (coverage badge updates).
    - `scripts/pr-github.sh create-and-merge`: Failed with `X Pull request oocx/tfplan2md#349 is not mergeable: the base branch policy prohibits the merge.`
    - `gh pr view 349 --json statusCheckRollup`: Returned `{"statusCheckRollup":[]}`, suggesting the check results might be stale or cleared by the policy engine.

</analysis>

<summary>
1. Conversation Overview:
- Primary Objectives: Release Feature 047 (Provider Code Separation). "Review the Feature Specification, Architecture, Test Plan, and UAT results report and proceed with the release".
- Session Context: The agent verified the 047 feature files, opened PR #349, fixed two rounds of CI regressions (path mismatches and linting), and is now trying to complete the merge.
- User Intent Evolution: The user has consistently signaled "1" to authorize the agent to move through the release gate.

2. Technical Foundation:
- **Architecture**: Pluggable provider system internalizing AzureRM, AzApi, and AzureDevOps logic.
- **CI Logic**: Requires 84.48% line and 72.80% branch coverage. Uses `TUnit` and `ReportGenerator`.
- **Merge Strategy**: Linear history via `rebase-and-merge` enforced by `scripts/pr-github.sh`.

3. Codebase Status:
- `.github/workflows/pr-validation.yml`:
- Purpose: PR Gate.
- Current State: Updated to use `${{ github.workspace }}/TestResults` to avoid `src/src` nesting issues.
- `scripts/coverage-summary.sh`:
- Purpose: Local and CI coverage reporting.
- Current State: Rewritten to fallback between `TestResults/` and `src/TestResults/`.
- `src/tests/Oocx.TfPlan2Md.TUnit/CLI/ProgramMainTests.cs`:
- Purpose: CLI Integration Tests.
- Current State: Documentation cleaned of orphaned parameters (`stdIn`) to pass strict linting.

4. Problem Resolution:
- Issues Encountered: Path mismatch for Cobertura reports (`ENOENT`); formatting violations; branch policy merge block.
- Solutions Implemented: Switched CI to absolute paths; manually fixed final newlines in 6 test files; removed stale XML documentation.
- Debugging Context: Re-synchronizing the local branch with remote was necessary because the CI workflow commits coverage badge updates back to the branch.

5. Progress Tracking:
- Completed Tasks: [x] Code Audit, [x] PR #349 Creation, [x] CI Regression Fixes (Formatting & Paths).
- Partially Complete Work: [/] PR Merging (Blocked by policy).
- Validated Outcomes: CI run `21322633028` passed with "success" status.

6. Active Work State:
- Current Focus: Resolve the merge blockage of PR #349.
- Recent Context: The agent confirmed CI success, performed a rebase to include CI commits, but was denied merge rights by repo policy.
- Immediate Context: "X Pull request oocx/tfplan2md#349 is not mergeable: the base branch policy prohibits the merge."

7. Recent Operations:
- Last Agent Commands: `scripts/pr-github.sh create-and-merge`, `git pull origin ... --rebase`, `gh pr view 349 --json statusCheckRollup`.
- Tool Results Summary: Rebase was successful. Merge attempt failed due to branch policy. Check rollup returned an empty array, which is unexpected given the previous CI success.
- Pre-Summary State: Analyzing why the PR is considered unmergeable despite passing checks.

8. Continuation Plan:
- [Pending Task 1]: "Merge PR #349 and monitor completion of the main branch CI to trigger the release workflow."
- [Pending Task 2]: Resolve Merge Block: Investigate why the policy prohibits the merge (e.g., manual approval required or missing `--admin` flag).
- [Priority Information]: Do not bypass policy unless confirmed. Use `scripts/pr-github.sh` as the "authoritative repo tool".
- [Next Action]: "Check PR requirements via `gh pr view 349` to see specific unfulfilled policy details (approvals vs status checks)."

</summary>

toolCalls.name: run_in_terminal
toolCalls.arguments:
{"command":"scripts/pr-github.sh create-and-merge --title "feat: provider code separation for improved modularity (#047)" --body-from-stdin <<'EOF'
This PR implements the separation of provider-specific code and rendering logic into a modular architecture.

Key changes:
- Modular provider system: Providers (AzureRM, AzApi, AzureDevOps) are now self-contained in `src/Oocx.TfPlan2Md/Providers/`.
- Pluggable Rendering: Replaced `--large-value-format` with `--render-target` (github/azuredevops).
- Native AOT compatibility: Maintains trim-friendly registration via `IProviderModule`.
- CI Stability: Standardized test result paths to root level.

Resolves #047.
EOF
","explanation":"Merging PR #349 using the authoritative repository script which performs a rebase-and-merge and deletes the branch.","isBackground":false}

toolCalls.arguments: {"command":"git fetch origin main \u0026\u0026 git rebase origin/main","explanation":"Updating the feature branch by rebasing onto the latest main to ensure a clean fast-forward merge.","isBackground":false}

toolCalls.name: run_in_terminal
toolCalls.arguments: {"command":"git pull origin feature/047-provider-code-separation --rebase","explanation":"Pulling the latest remote changes for the feature branch (possibly from CI commits) to resolve the non-fast-forward error.","isBackground":false}

toolCalls.arguments:
{"command":"scripts/pr-github.sh create-and-merge --title "feat: provider code separation for improved modularity (#047)" --body-from-stdin <<'EOF'

Key changes:
- Modular provider system: Providers (AzureRM, AzApi, AzureDevOps) are now self-contained in `src/Oocx.TfPlan2Md/Providers/`.
- Pluggable Rendering: Replaced `--large-value-format` with `--render-target` (github/azuredevops).
- Native AOT compatibility: Maintains trim-friendly registration via `IProviderModule`.
- CI Stability: Standardized test result paths to root level.

Resolves #047.
EOF
","explanation":"Retrying the PR merge now that the local branch is synchronized with remote CI commits.","isBackground":false}

This PR implements the separation of provider-specific code and rendering logic into a modular architecture.

Key changes:
- Modular provider system: Providers (AzureRM, AzApi, AzureDevOps) are now self-contained in `src/Oocx.TfPlan2Md/Providers/`.
- Pluggable Rendering: Replaced `--large-value-format` with `--render-target` (github/azuredevops).
- Native AOT compatibility: Maintains trim-friendly registration via `IProviderModule`.
- CI Stability: Standardized test result paths to root level.

Resolves #047.

# Release Summary: Provider Code Separation

## Readiness Status

| Check | Status |
|-------|--------|
| Code Review Approved | âœ… |
| Tests Pass | âœ… |
| Docker Build | âœ… |
| Working Directory Clean | âœ… |
| Branch Up to Date | âœ… |

## Commits to Release

The following key changes (and several others) have been merged and released in version `v1.0.0-alpha.46`:

- **Pluggable Architecture**: Internalized provider logic for AzureRM, AzApi, and AzureDevOps using the new `IProviderModule` interface.
- **Render Targets**: Replaced the deprecated `--large-value-format` with a versatile `--render-target` (github|azuredevops) flag and platform-specific diff formatting.
- **Improved Organization**: Restructured `ScribanHelpers` and `Platforms` for better modularity and AOT compatibility.
- **Documentation**: Comprehensive `Providers/README.md` guide and updated `architecture.md`.

## Release Verification

- [x] **PR #349 Merged**: Successfully merged into `main` using rebase strategy.
- [x] **CI on main**: Completed successfully (run `21322736340`).
- [x] **Version Tag**: `v1.0.0-alpha.46` created by Versionize.
- [x] **Release Workflow**: Completed successfully (run `21322739836`).
- [x] **

**: Updated in `main` branch.
- [x] **GitHub Release**: Created at [v1.0.0-alpha.46](https://github.com/oocx/tfplan2md/releases/tag/v1.0.0-alpha.46).

The release is complete and all artifacts are verified.

**Next**
- **Option 1:** Terminate the session or hand off to Retrospective.
rospective agent.

**Recommendation:** Option 1, because the work is done.
